org.hps.readout.trigger2019

Class SinglesTrigger2019ReadoutDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.util.Driver
      • org.hps.readout.ReadoutDriver
        • org.hps.readout.TriggerDriver
          • org.hps.readout.trigger2019.SinglesTrigger2019ReadoutDriver

  • public class SinglesTrigger2019ReadoutDriver
extends TriggerDriver
    SinglesTrigger2019ReadoutDriver simulates an HPS singles trigger for 2019 MC. It takes in clusters produced by the GTPClusterReadoutDriver and hodoscope patterns produced by the HodoscopePatternReadoutDriver, and perform the necessary trigger logic on them. If a trigger is detected, it is sent to the readout data manager so that a triggered readout event may be written.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class org.lcsim.util.Driver

    • Field Detail

      • triggerType

        private String triggerType
        Indicates singles trigger type. Corresponding DAQ configuration is accessed by DAQ configuration system, and applied into readout.

      • ecalGeometryName

        private String ecalGeometryName
        Indicates the name of the calorimeter geometry object. This is needed to allow access to the calorimeter channel listings.

      • inputCollectionNameEcal

        private String inputCollectionNameEcal
        Specifies the name of the LCIO collection containing the input GTP clusters that are used for triggering.

      • inputCollectionNameHodo

        private String inputCollectionNameHodo

      • beamEnergy

        private double beamEnergy
        Specifies the beam energy for the input data. This defines the limits of the energy trigger plots and has no further effect.

      • triggerModule

        private TriggerModule2019 triggerModule
        Stores the trigger settings and performs trigger logic.

      • localTime

        private double localTime
        Tracks the current local time in nanoseconds for this driver.

      • ecal

        private HPSEcal3 ecal
        Stores a reference to the calorimeter subdetector model. This is needed to extract the crystal indices from the cell ID.

      • BIN_SIZE

        private static final double BIN_SIZE
        Defines the size of an energy bin for trigger output plots.

        public void setDaqConfigurationAppliedintoReadout(boolean state)
        Sets whether or not the DAQ configuration is applied into the driver the EvIO data stream or whether to read the configuration from data files.
        Parameters:
        state - - true indicates that the DAQ configuration is applied into the readout system, and false that it is not applied into the readout system.

      • getTimeDisplacement

        protected double getTimeDisplacement()
        Description copied from class: ReadoutDriver
        Specifies the amount of simulation time that the driver needs to produce its output. This indicates that the driver's present output was generated based on input a time equal to (getCurrentTime() - getTimeDisplacement()).
        Specified by:
        getTimeDisplacement in class ReadoutDriver
        Returns:
        Returns the time displacement of output data as a double.

      • getTimeNeededForLocalOutput

        protected double getTimeNeededForLocalOutput()
        Description copied from class: ReadoutDriver
        Specifies the amount of simulation time that the driver needs to produce special on-trigger data.
        Specified by:
        getTimeNeededForLocalOutput in class ReadoutDriver
        Returns:
        Returns the time displacement of output data as a double.

      • setBeamEnergy

        public void setBeamEnergy(double value)
        Sets the beam energy for the trigger. This is only used to determine the range of the x-axis for trigger plots.
        Parameters:
        value - - The beam energy of the input data, in units of GeV.

      • setHitCountThreshold

        public void setHitCountThreshold(int hitCountThreshold)
        Sets the minimum hit count threshold for the trigger. This value is inclusive.
        Parameters:
        hitCountThreshold - - The value of the threshold.
